document_title: Hyperuricemia: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_name: tang-acid-uric-mau.json_2_Causes of increased blood uric acid
subsection_content:
The cause of high uric acid mainly comes from purine content in the body that is higher than necessary.
In addition, factors such as genetics, environment, diet and living habits are reasons that can affect the increase or decrease of uric acid in the human body.
Risk factors for hyperacidity include:
Metabolic syndrome; Abusing or using alcohol regularly; People with a history of hypertension; People with diabetes; People eat uncontrollably purine-rich foods such as red meat, shellfish, etc.; People using loop diuretics and thiazides.
